disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Monday 20 June to end of Monday 20 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: A return to sunny weather on Monday although a continuing northerly breeze will prevent the temperature going much above 20 C. The incoming air will also carry little by way of imported pollution, thereby limiting the availability of the precursor chemicals required for ground-level ozone to form.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants throughout the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Tuesday 21 June to end of Tuesday 21 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Forecast sunny all day on Tuesday.<br/><br/>A cool, very light North Sea breeze is expected. This should prevent it getting too warm, with temperatures expected to stay in the mid twenties. In addition, incoming air is not expected to carry much by way of imported pollution, thereby limiting the availability of the precursor chemicals required for ground-level ozone to form.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants throughout the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>
